text: [SQUEAKING]
[RUSTLING]
[CLICKING]
KRISHNA RAJAGOPAL: Hi, there.

As we were doing the last
time I spoke with you,

the OCW team and I continue
to work from our homes

and produce OpenCourseWare
remotely in light
of the ongoing pandemic.

My very best wishes to
all of you and yours.

Be well and stay well
wherever you are.

Throughout this prolonged season
of challenges and uncertainty,

we continue to find inspiration
in the persistence of OCW

learners and their
dedication to learning.

We are heartened to be of
service during this time.

Now going six months
strong from home,

the team is committed
to maintaining

the quality of OCW for you
and all the many of you

who are turning to
OCW at this time.

Use of OCW remains strong
with a substantial increase

in daily site visits
compared to last year.

With so much happening
online these days,

the importance of video and
reaching learners is profound.

That's why we're so excited
to have recently surpassed

2.6 million subscribers to
the OCW YouTube channel.

We're also thrilled to share
that the first season of Chalk
Radio is now available in full.

This season of the podcast
brought critical and timely

conversations about remote
teaching during the pandemic,

about the relationship between
language, identity, culture,

and power, and
about the benefits

and potential of
teaching with OER.

We invite you to listen
if you haven't already.

And all of you should stay tuned
for the second season debuting
later this month.

Next year, OpenCourseWare will
celebrate its 20th anniversary.

As we approach
this milestone, we

are reflecting on what
OCW means to the world

today, a world that looks and
learns very differently than we

could have imagined
back in 2001.

What has not changed is MIT's
commitment to the simple,

but bold idea that openly
sharing educational resources

created by MIT's teachers
for MIT's students

for anyone to use can
change lives, expand minds,

enhance careers, and
help to make a better
world for all of us.
And the stakes are high.

As we see every day, with an
ongoing global public health

crisis, with a painful
nationwide reckoning

with the systemic advantages and
disadvantages that have shaped

so much of our lives, and
with the daunting reality

of our rapidly changing climate,
in all these ways and more,
our fates are interconnected.

In the face of all
of this embracing

our lifelong curiosity,
our need to learn and adapt

has never been more
important or more personal.

We believe that free
access to knowledge

and open educational
resources like OCW

can be powerful tools in
helping us to understand
these deeply complex issues.

You can read more about the role
of open educational resources

in creating a more just world
and a new piece on our website
from OCW director, Curt Newton.

The primary way we are preparing
to mark OCW's 20th anniversary

is by reimagining the OCW
platform to better realize

MIT's unchanging
commitment to sharing

its teaching in the service
of learners like you
for the next 20 years.

The NextGen OCW
platform will further

improve global educational
equity and access

by allowing millions more
learners around the world
to learn from OCW.

Currently in the
prototype phase,

new features include a seamless
user experience optimized

across all your devices,
from smartphones

to mobile to desktops, so you
can learn with OCW wherever
you are.

An enhanced search
experience to make

course content across the
full broad sweep of OCW

and our new Open Learning
Library easier to find.

And a vastly streamlined
process for authoring

OCW content on our
side that will make it

much easier and quicker
for MIT's teachers

to share perspectives
and pedagogies,

educational technologies, and
tools of today and tomorrow

with all of you around
the world keeping

OCW current, vibrant,
and full of energy.

Recently, one of
my colleagues, who

was trying to capture the
magic of MIT in a phrase,

said that students and teachers
here are vibrating with energy.

NextGen OCW will share
some of that magic, some

of that energy, some
of those vibrations,

with millions of learners
like you for years to come.

We look forward to sharing our
and your new platform with you

next year and hope
you will join us

in celebrating 20 years
of OpenCourseWare,

the power of Open, everyone
who helped us get here,

and the millions of you
who have learned with us.

Whether you're a student, an
educator, a lifelong learner,

or just discovering OCW
for the very first time,
we're so glad you're here.

Thank you for being
a part of OCW.
